Short description: Developer Conference for Ethereum Infrastructure and Dapps.
Developer Conference for Ethereum Infrastructure and Dapps.
Developer Conference for Ethereum Infrastructure and Dapps.
The decentralized protocol and infrastructure conference.
Long description: Protocol Berg is a one-day technical conference for protocol/system/network engineers, decentralized-infrastructure administrators, researchers, and other curious minds from different ecosystems. Attendance is free of charge. The event will not host any sponsors or commercial talks.

Short description: The event will feature Blockchain use cases from Berlin to showcase the thriving community, it's creativity and bring new people into the scene.
Long description:
BerChain and Berlin Partner invite you to the Blockchain in Use Conference 2023!

As part of the Berlin Blockchain Week 2023, the 4th iteration of the BiU will gather relevant overview on how the use of blockchain can help us overcome the current challenges various industries are facing. Furthermore, it will address the current obstacles to wider adoption and how to achieve it.

This year the Blockchain in Use Conference will focus use cases and blockchain key players within the following track:
(a) FinTech,
(b) Creative Industries, and 
(c) Growth Ecosystem.

With inspiring keynotes, demos, and panel discussions current opportunities and challenges will be discussed

Short description: Decentralization celebration extravaganza
Long description: The Full Node Berlin Party is a vibrant and inclusive event that celebrates the spirit of decentralization, blockchain technology, and the Ethereum ecosystem in Berlin.

Short description: Panel talk and keynote about NFT communities, catering, live music and NFT art exhibtion
Long description:
We are hosting our 2nd NFT event at data space Berlin. Expect a panel talk and keynote about NFT communities, featuring some of the leading figures in the german NFT space.   The event is free but signups via https://lu.ma/nftlab_berlin  is necessary. Expect free food, drinks, live music and an NFT art exhibtion.

Speakers, partners and a detailed agenda will be announced via twitter:

https://twitter.com/nftlab_berlin

Short description: A classic W3FC event combining football & web3 in one amazing daytime event.
An analog generative art experience

We are excited to bring together regenerative thinkers and doers in DAOs, ReFi, DeSci, Platform Coops, Purpose Orgs, Climate Activism, and Art to co-create & share projects, knowledge, food, kindness and hope.
Long description:
Regens Unite is a fresh way of gathering a widely sourced group of people who are working on regenerative solutions for themselves, for communities, and for our planet. Its focus is on connecting meaningfully with each other to learn and grow resilience.

We are excited to bring together regenerative thinkers and doers in DAOs, ReFi, DeSci, Platform Coops, Purpose Orgs, Climate Activism, and Art to co-create & share projects, knowledge, food, kindness and hope.

No top-down presentations. All activities are participatory:

Facilitated workshops
Round circle discussions
Co-creation spaces
Relaxation areas
‍
Core topics include:

Building healthy cultures for regenerative organizations & contributors
Alternative ownership models & equitable governance design
Developing better tools, solutions & infrastructure for these models
Ethical marketing & growth for good
Regenerative practices for self-care

Last year's event: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CAI0Zc39rm8

Short description: Safe{Con} is the inaugural builder conference aimed to accelerate the transition to smart accounts. This event is a unique blend of announcements, workshops and engagements with a community of builders building the best user-friendly, secure, interoperable and modular smart account use cases. The event aims to foster a community to take ownership of the transition from EOAs to smart accounts and contribute to the broader Ethereum ecosystem.
Long description: Safe{Con} is the inaugural builder conference aimed to accelerate the transition to smart accounts. This event is a unique blend of announcements, workshops and engagements with a community of builders building the best user-friendly, secure, interoperable and modular smart account use cases. The event aims to foster a community to take ownership of the transition from EOAs to smart accounts and contribute to the broader Ethereum ecosystem.

Short description: The 7th edition of Funding the Commons will be held in Berlin on 8-9 September, set against the vibrant and innovative backdrop of Germany's capital city. This event will be held in partnership with DeSci Berlin, aligning itself with the bustling Berlin Blockchain Week.  The Berlin edition of Funding the Commons will feature a unique emphasis on builders and interactive programming. In contrast to the storied academia of our Paris event, Berlin will celebrate the hands-on spirit of creation and innovation.
Long description:
This year, DeSci.Berlin and Funding the Commons join forces to host their next editions during Berlin Blockchain Week, set to unfold in the city's vibrant tech landscape on 8-9 September.

On the 8th, DeSci.Berlin takes center stage, orchestrating intensive workshops and insightful talks by key players in the field. Attendees will delve into the complexities of decentralized science, from innovative research funding avenues to the conceptualization of biotech DAOs.

On the 9th, Funding the Commons takes the reins, and will feature a unique emphasis on builders and interactive programming. In contrast to the storied academia of its Paris event, Berlin FTC will celebrate the hands-on spirit of creation and innovation. Funding the Commons Berlin offers an ideal platform for participants to engage with the wider blockchain and decentralized science communities. The event is designed to catalyze the development of new partnerships and projects. Through this interactive format, Funding the Commons Berlin will champion the advancement of public goods funding in the heart of Europe's tech scene.

This combined event will ignite the development of new partnerships, projects, and initiatives with each day providing a distinct platform to engage with the wider blockchain and decentralized science communities.

Short description: Afterparty for the Funding the Commons/DeSci Berlin conference
Long description: The FtC/DeSci Berlin afterparty is open to ticketholders for the event taking place 8-9 September, in celebration of a fruitful two days learning and building together. We will flow from hors d'oeuvres and connecting over drinks in the Halle to an evening of beats and dancing in the Basement.

Title of your event: Polygon Connect Berlin - DevX Global Tour, EMEA
Short description: Polygon Connect - EMEA is coming to Berlin! Join us on the 16th of September to be part of the DevX Global Tour!!
Long description:
What a whirlwind that was Europe DevX Global Tour EMEA - Our flagship event, Polygon Connect is coming to Berlin, Germany! 🇩🇪

Polygon Connect EMEA is the celebration the second installment of DevX Global Tour, a global gathering of tech builders and innovators, supported by our incredible partners. The tour kicked off in earlier this year in APAC, then migrated to Europe with an array of Guild meet-ups, an online hackathon, and we are now celebrating our community and developers in Berlin during Dappcon & Protocol Berg!

🔥 Welcome to Polygon Connect EMEA!

Title of your event: Tacos with Nerif (Berlin Blockchain Week Edition)
Short description: ​​​​Join Nerif for a night of Tacos and Margaritas in Berlin. Meet fellow buidlers to discuss what is up next in web3!

We're thrilled to extend an invitation to universities and all attendees of the upcoming Berlin Blockchain Week for our Lisk SDK Hackathon. The event, organized by Lisk, will be held in a hybrid format at the Lisk Center in Berlin on the 9-10 of September, allowing for both in-person and virtual participation.
Long description:
This Hackathon offers a unique platform for students to explore and immerse themselves in blockchain applications and technology. Participants will gain hands-on experience with the latest Lisk SDK 6, a comprehensive toolkit designed for creating blockchain applications using JavaScript.

Total Prizes: 8,000 USD in LSK Winner: 2,500 USD in LSK Second Place: 1,000 USD in LSK Third Place: 500 USD in LSK Special Award: Lisk Bootstrap Grant The winner will also receive the Lisk Bootstrap Grant, amounting to 4,000 USD, paid in LSK.

Title of your event: crypto girls club launch party with polygon, webmint, ravespace, lisk & NFT brazil
Short description: ​Keeping the onchain summer spirit alive for Berlin Blockchain Week. 🌞⛓️  ​We've teamed up with Polygon, ravespace, webmint, and NFT Brazil to bring you an immersive evening celebrating crypto girl's club genesis membership collection.
Long description:
​What's a mint without a party?

​Our lineup includes speakers from Polygon and Webmint, and we've got a couple of special guests – ravespace and NFT Brazil who'll be exploring the insection between digital and the real world.

​We're bringing you a live membership minting session, plus an exciting auction led by the rarepepe NFT expert, Theo Goodman. Mint your membership on the night and then join us for some networking & fun.

​PANEL 🎤 Topic: Building a Global Ecosystem with Polygon

​AUCTION & LIVE MINT 🔥 Join us for a live auction hosted by rarepepe auctioneer Theo Goodman

​LIVE DJ SET beats powered by Rave.space

​NFT GALLERY & IMMERSIVE DISPLAY 🎨

​Check out our NFT art gallery curated by the Crypto Girls Club community &  NFTBrazil in a highly immersive environment. Our focus? Female empowerment of course.

​Food and drinks throughout the night @ Lisk center Berlin

​Learn more about the CGC membership minting on 12:09: https://www.cryptogirlsclub.org/join-the-club

Short description: We'll talk UX, mass adoption, onboarding fuelled by free beer and peanuts. Short talks, long drinks :)

Hosted at Aeve, Chainflip returns again to Berlin Blockchain Week with another legendary Berlin classic rave at one of the city's infamous nightlife venues in Kreuzberg.  Chainflip community members & Berlin Blockchain Week participants are welcome to apply for free entry here.

Title of your event: RWA Deep Dive @ Berlin Blockchain Week
Short description: ​Centrifuge, the first protocol to bring real-world assets onchain, joins forces with Mauve, the first decentralized exchange with the compliance of traditional finance, to host an RWA Deep Dive and happy hour event during Berlin Blockchain Week.
Long description:
​Centrifuge, the first protocol to bring real-world assets onchain, joins forces with Mauve, the first decentralized exchange with the compliance of traditional finance, to host an RWA Deep Dive and happy hour event during Berlin Blockchain Week.

Title of your event: Beers in the park with Ultimate
Short description: Let's have a beer together after the first day of DappCon!  Location: Down the street from DappCon is Berlin's famous "East Side Gallery", a park alongside a long section of the former Berlin Wall. We'll hang out in the park there.
Long description: Bluetooth speaker + crates of beer = vibes

Title of your event: Ocean Protocol Berlin Blockchain Week Meetup
Short description: Discover the exciting crossroads of AI, Web3, blockchain, and data at the Ocean Protocol Meetup in Berlin. Join our core team members and Ocean Protocol Builders guests as they share practical insights and engage in meaningful conversations. Whether you're tech-savvy or just curious, this event offers a relaxed and inspiring atmosphere to explore the future of technology.
Long description:
Join us at the Ocean Protocol Meetup in Berlin for a dynamic exploration of AI, Web3, blockchain, and data. This event is all about real conversations and practical insights. Our core team members will be sharing their expertise, and we're excited to have guests from the Ocean Protocol Builders community who are pushing the boundaries of what's possible.

Expect engaging talks that cut through the jargon and get to the heart of what matters. We're bringing together AI, Web3, blockchain, and data enthusiasts for a relaxed evening of learning and connecting. No matter your background, if you're curious about how these technologies are shaping the world, this meetup is for you.

Discover the future of tech, make new connections, and get inspired at the Ocean Protocol Meetup in Berlin. Don't miss out – see you there!

Short description: ​Join us for an intriguing evening of discussion and networking at Solana's Ecosystem Night, taking place during Berlin Blockchain Week at the Ultimate Finance Office in Berlin. This event will provide a comprehensive overview of Solana's presence and impact within the German blockchain ecosystem.  ​The schedule includes brief presentations from our event partners, offering insights into their experiences and projects related to Solana.
MeetUP! is a developer-first event crafted to accelerate the adoption of smart contract-based accounts (AA). MeetUP! is a collaboration opportunity to push Account Abstraction to the next level.
Long description:
MeetUP! is a developer-first event crafted to accelerate the adoption of smart contract-based accounts (AA). MeetUP! is a collaboration opportunity to push Account Abstraction to the next level. We explore new avenues of advancing UX and introducing the new standards that will make real Smart Contract Accounts possible. Bring your ideas and let's discuss the future of web3!

This event will have a combination of workshops, announcements, and community engagement opportunities with builders throughout the ecosystem. It is also the office warming party of LUKSO new Hub and the birthday party of @feindura !!

After the meetup, we’ll open the dance floor for all participants to enjoy an evening in Berlin with a live DJ until late in the night! 🕺💃Also Sisyphos is right next door, for the ones who want to make it even longer 😋

Please apply to RSVP - the event is limited capacity and approval will be required for all attendees.

*Food and drinks will be provided 😋

#LUKSOMeetUP

Short description: KODA presents a one-night-only Onchain Art Exhibition on September 13, 6pm-10pm at Factory Berlin Görlitzer Park. Experience onchain gallery, a generative art workshop, POAP, networking and more. Food & Drinks included. Meet fellow degens & support the culture.
Long description:
​The KodaDot Onchain Art Exhibition is a one-night showcase of onchain art and culture happening on September 13 from 6pm - 10pm at Factory Berlin Görlitzer Park.

​Attendees can explore onchain galleries, participate in a generative art workshop, receive a POAP and 10 EUR voucher for KodaDot's merch store.

Your ticket includes:

​- Access to onchain art gallery

​- Food and drinks

​- Generative art workshop

​- POAP

​- 10 EUR voucher for KodaDot merch store

​- Networking with fellow NFT/blockchain enthusiasts

​- Interactive art installations

​- 1 night only - don't miss Berlin's premier onchain experience!

Short description: WebZero invites you to an almost forgotten dimension to celebrate the parity of civilization and technology while being immersed in the blockspace.
Long description:
The challenge of civilization can be equated with the challenge of technology. The further we can push technology, the further we will push civilization. If we could push technology all the way back to the stone age, there would be no more civilization. 

WebZero invites you to an almost forgotten dimension to celebrate the parity of civilization and technology while being immersed in the blockspace.
Address: Vor dem Schlesischen Tor 3, Berlin Kreuzberg, 10997

Title of your event: INTRODUCING CIRCLES ENTROPY: Weaving privacy into trust networks & Local Market
Short description: Come to Moos Space for a community market, dinner, dance, and learn about the pioneering Circles Entropy project, hosted by Circles Coop, the team behind CirclesUBI and the Open UBI Pilot in Berlin.
Long description:
Come to Moos Space for a community market, dinner, dance, and learn about the pioneering Circles Entropy project, hosted by Circles Coop, the team behind CirclesUBI and the Open UBI Pilot in Berlin.

Circles Entropy presents a revolutionary approach to the problem of surveillance, enabling individuals to freely & securely participate in their own digital networks.

Join a critical dialogue between pioneering projects and public intellectuals, discussing the future of digital money and privacy-preserving technologies.

*The event is free, please RSVP.

WHEN:

September 13th, 17:00-24:00

📍LOCATION:

MOOS Space

Moosdorfstraße 7-9 · Berlin

⏰ Schedule:

17:00 Gates open & Community Market

19:30 Anonymity and Privacy: Can We Build 'Islands of Low Data Entropy' for Individuals? - a public discussion with our guest speakers

20:15 Introducing Circles Entropy

21:00 Concert by Adz

21:30 Celebrations, Music and Dance 🎉

🎤 Our guest speakers for the public discussion:

Brett Scott - author and economic anthropologist

Julio Linares - cofounder of Circles Entropy, economic anthropologist

Jaya Klarra Brekke - philosopher of technology and Chief Strategist NYM

Max Hampshire - Senior Developer Relations NYM

Chris Goes - co-founder of Anoma Network

Yulia Khalniyazova - Researcher at Anoma Network

🌏What is Circles?

Circles is a community currency which aims at creating an unconditional basic income from the bottom-up, allowing people, cooperatives, businesses and communities to exchange with each other the things that they need for the resources available in the region. You can read more here joincircles.net and here handbook.joincircles.net .

⚛️What is Circles Entropy?

A protocol dedicated to tackling data privacy and security issues in today's digital credit and payment landscape. Circles Entropy presents a revolutionary approach to the problem of surveillance, enabling individuals to freely & securely participate in their own digital networks. Our strong commitment to safeguarding user information empowers individuals with complete data autonomy and unwavering privacy guarantees. You can read more here https://entropy.circles.coop/

Short description: ​Join us for the thrilling ‘Battle of the Blockchains’ event, hosted by CV Labs and Spyce5. During the event, some of the most prominent blockchain projects will compete to showcase their cutting-edge technologies and added values. You’ll get to meet Cosmos, IOTA/Shimmer, Lisk, and Lukso, . This event aims to foster an open dialogue and healthy competition among various blockchain ecosystems to explore the potential and future prospects of decentralized technologies.
Long description:
Description:

​Join us for the thrilling ‘Battle of the Blockchains’ event, hosted by CV Labs and Spyce5. During the event, some of the most prominent blockchain projects will compete to showcase their cutting-edge technologies and added values. You’ll get to meet Cosmos, IOTA/Shimmer, Lisk, and Lukso, . This event aims to foster an open dialogue and healthy competition among various blockchain ecosystems to explore the potential and future prospects of decentralized technologies.

​

​Event Agenda:

​Introduction and Welcome 
​The event kicks off with an introduction by the host, highlighting the importance of blockchain technology and web3 and its potential impact on various industries.

​

​Technology Pitch Presentations 
​Representatives from each participating blockchain will have a golden opportunity to pitch their technologies and specific approaches. In concise five-minute presentations, they will elucidate the strengths, scalability, security features, consensus mechanisms, and unique selling points of their respective blockchain projects.

​

​Panel Discussion: Do We Need Different Chains? 
​Following the pitch presentations, all representatives will gather on a panel, and a seasoned moderator will lead the discussion. The central question of the debate will be: "Do we need different chains, and if so, why?" Participants will explore the aspects that make diverse blockchain ecosystems relevant, including use case specialization, scalability concerns, regional applicability, and governance models.

​

​Short Fireside Chat with Olaf Hannemann, Founder and CIO of CV VC. 
​Olaf will present the second edition of the German Blockchain Report by CV VC, which will be launched during the event

​

​Networking and Drinks

Short description: Join us for the kick-off event for curious minds that want to stay on top of the strongest innovation in the blockchain space.
Long description:
Learn about provable Rust-like language Cairo, powered by zk STARKs, the layer 2 validity rollup StarkNet that scales Ethereum, account abstraction, decentralized sequencers, provers and much more.

We're bringing together developers, enthusiasts, and industry experts for an introduction to StarkNet during the Berlin Blockchain Week.

Short description: House of Chaos is a new and innovative, tech-driven take on immersive and interactive theatre. It takes guests on a journey into futurism, privacy, truth, deception and wisdom where they use technological tools in ways they never have before.
Long description:
House of Chaos is a new and innovative, tech-driven take on immersive and interactive theatre. It takes guests on a journey into futurism, privacy, truth, deception and wisdom where they use technological tools in ways they never have before.

​The event is hosted in a former multiplex cinema with a historical building at its core. The venue will be transformed with projection mapping and effects by the team behind “Festival of Lights”.
Event type: Immersive tech/art experience with after party

Title of your event: 🥩 night with Finoa, Diva, Chorus.One and friends
Short description: Insightful ETH staking panel with experts, followed by pizza, drinks, and networking
Long description: ​Join us at the Finoa office for a casual gathering of crypto enthusiasts, contributors, researchers, and Berliners to celebrate the Berlin Blockchain Week and community. We will be hosting an interesting panel on everything ETH staking uncovering some of the industry’s current challenges and opportunities in the eyes of different experts, followed by pizza (not steak), drinks, and mingling.

Title of your event: Web3 Rooftop Night with Drinks and Pizza
Short description: Welshare Health invites you to enjoy the sunset of Berlin together after the second day of DappCon! Cold Drinks and delicious Pizza provided throughout the night after successful registration!

Title of your event: Music x Web3 Collaborative Exploration: LAB3 meets Aurale Agency
Short description: In collaboration with Aurale Agency, known for their fantastic Music Marketing Meetups in Neukölln, we are thrilled to present a dynamic event that merges the realms of music, Web3 technologies, and cutting-edge discussions about the future of the music industry.
Long description:
Expect an intro to Web3 x Music x NFTs by LAB3’s founders Miguel & Moritz and Aurale Agency’s Julien, followed by an in-depth Q&A with Bernhard Heintzen, Head of Key Account for Authors at GEMA and lead by Nadia Says to learn about the implications of Web3 on music sale formats like Bandcamp and NFTs, and finalized by a music NFT preview by DVDV.

Following the stage talks, we will encourage everyone to introduce themselves, engage in thought-provoking discussions, and forge new connections.

More info about the speakers via:

lab3.space
linkedin.com/company/apeunit
linkedin.com/in/miguel-lizio-14b7a43a
aurale.agency
linkedin.com/in/jsaumande
linkedin.com/in/bernhard-heintzen-2708bb1b4
linkedin.com/in/nadiasays
instagram.com/dvvvdvvv
linktr.ee/djlimbs
As the doors open at 6:00 PM, we'll set the mood with tunes played by one of our community DJs. *chill sounds provided by community member Dj Limbs.

Attendees don't need any tech affinity and prior knowledge of web3 and NFTs to join.

This meetup is part of an event series that aims to create a knowledge exchange community for music makers around Web3; previous guests include Nadia Says, Founder of the creative platform YourMomsAgency.com, and @YourMomsBerlin. Jesse Steele and Patrick Caire, Co-Founders of Loominate.co, and Thor Hagedorn/ Co-Founder of Diasporic Arts Alliance (diasporicaa.com).

LAB3 is a place where music professionals can learn more about Web3 technologies like NFTs, DAOs, and ERC20 tokens, exchange best practices with experts and aficionados, and start their own Web3 experiments.

Title of your event: WebSpree - Sundowner at the Kater Cantine (by DIA, LI.FI and Phala Network)
Short description: Berlin Blockchain Week is on and we the hosts, DIA, Phala Network and LI.FI want to seize this opportunity to gather our friends, partners and combined networks for a sundowner afternoon right at Berlin’s river Spree.  ​With tasty drinks and snacks, chill music and networking at a beautiful location, we offer a timeout from the main conference and recharge your batteries from the packed program of talks and presentations at Dappcon.

Title of your event: Schelling Point Sessions Berlin with Other Internet, Radworks + Gitcoin
Short description: Community led, participatory conversations in the same spirit of Schelling Point but in a smaller, more intimate environment.
Long description:
Schelling Point is where people converge around public goods and positive change.

After the success of this newly introduced format in Paris during EthCC week, we’re heading to Berlin Blockchain Week to partner with Other Internet and Radworks for participatory sessions focused on web3 work and DAOs: contribution, governance, leadership and life cycles. Session 1 & 2 will focus on governance and DAO organizational structures. Sessions 3 & 4 will focus on the life and death of DAOs and will close with a DAO memorial service/wake.

Location
Moos, Moosdorfstraße 7-9, 12435

Schedule

1:30pm - 2:00pm — Check in

2:00pm - 2:45pm — Sessions 1 & 2 with Radworks

2:45pm - 3:00pm — Break

3:00pm - 5:00pm - Sessions 3 & 4 with Other Internet

5:00pm - 6:00pm - Closing & happy hour 

Space is limited, apply to attend here: https://lu.ma/2jj0oepi

Short description: Learn about tokenization best practices and create your first web3 token effortlessly
Long description:
During this event, you will participate in an interactive workshop that will guide you through the process of creating tokens on a blockchain. We will explore various token and NFT use cases for DeFi projects, art and content creation. We will provide you with the necessary knowledge to easily create tokens for your project.

This event aims to equip you with the understanding and skills to get involved in the evolving Web3 landscape.

By the end of the workshop, you will have:

Learned about the principles of tokenization, blockchain, and Web3 technology
Seen the most popular applications of ERC20 tokens and NFTs
Created your first token on your smartphone
Join us in this educational and hands-on event, where you will have the opportunity to learn from industry experts.

We look forward to having you join us for an immersive experience at our office located in the heart of Berlin.

Please note that the event will be conducted in English.

Title of your event: A non-technical introduction to Regenerative Finance, an emerging climate tech frontier on the Blockchain.
Short description: Regenerative finance is emerging as the next climate tech frontier, providing the required transparency, efficiency, and speed to take effective climate action where it matters most.  On Tuesday, September 12th, at Factory Berlin for a complete introduction to Regenerative Finance. Various field experts will share the fundamentals and highlight developments in their respective fields of Regenerative Finance. The Transport and Climate Change Week and Berlin Blockchain Week are taking place simultaneously, creating the perfect nexus for technology-enabled climate action.  This event is relevant for individuals interested in the intersection of Climate, Finance, and Technology. N﻿o technical background is required to participate in the event.  T﻿his event is presented by Celo Europe and Kolektivo. For inquiries or questions, please reach out to luuk@kolektivo.co.
3x3 Basketball meets Web3
Long description: A 3x3 basketball tournament hosted by ALBA Berlin, where 16 teams from web3 communities will compete against each other. We'll also have other things happening like art workshops, digital eperiences and skills competitions.

Short description: drinks + doughnuts | cozy ambient beats
Interactive talks around Eth L2 onboarding + coworking
